ModuleInfo.Description:
A validation module which gives us start time vs duration information for the different purposes. As an input, it takes in the newly scheduled households and then produces different files for the different purposes. For each purpose, the module records when the trips start (hour). It then computes and records the average duration for all trips that start at a common start hour. As an output, the module produces average durations for each start hour data for all observed trip purposes scheduled by TASHA.

Note: The module can also be used on real data instead of TASHA run data. This is important when one wants to validate the duration of trips that TASHA is scheduling.

A validation module which gives us start time vs duration information for the different purposes. As an input, it takes in the newly scheduled households and then produces different files for the different purposes. For each purpose, the module records when the trips start (hour). It then computes and records the average duration for all trips that start at a common start hour. As an output, the module produces average durations for each start hour data for all observed trip purposes scheduled by TASHA.

Note: The module can also be used on real data instead of TASHA run data. This is important when one wants to validate the duration of trips that TASHA is scheduling.

ModuleInfo.Description: This module is used to compare TASHA start-times to the real data.As an input, the module takes in both files and asks which two variables should be be used as comparison. When the module concludes, it outputs a bar chart which compares the real and TASHA data and allows for visual inspection.

Attributes.Name: AM Rush Hour End Time

Attributes.Name: AM Rush Hour Start Time

Attributes.Name: Observed Mode Attachment Name

ModuleInfo.Description: This module is used to make Origin-Destination Matrices (.311 files) which can then be used with EMME to get travel times and costs. As an input, the module takes in household data and a zone system, and then creates the .311 file. For each mode (transit and auto), the module calculates an AM, PM and FF (off peak) O-D Matrix. The different matrices are based on the rush-hour start and end parameters inputteted. Note that the module adds together expansion factors and not just number of observations for te OD pairs.

This module is used as a validation step to ensure that a logical amount of trip purposes are being scheduled after the scheduler is complete. It counts both the frequency of trip purposes and the summation of the respective expansion factors.

This module takes in the Household data (either real or TASHA scheduled) and then computes and records the average distance travelled for the different start times of all trips. It does not compute separately for each trip purpose, but rather agglomerates them and produces start time vs distance of ALL trips. 
Note: The distance is calculated as Manhattan distance in meters.

This module is used to validate the Trip Distance of the TASHA results. As an input, it takes in the currently scheduled households and uses the trip chains of each member and calculates the Manhattan distance between the origin and destination of each trip. Finally, it outputs a file which has the frequency of all distances traveled.

This module is used for validation purposes. It computes and records the start times of activities immediately after the scheduler is finished. This is important as it allows for the analysis of the planned schedule before mode choice occurs.

A validation module that counts the length of the different trip chains scheduled by TASHA. As an input it takes in the newly scheduled trip chains from TASHA and then counts the length of each trip-chain. The output is a table that shows the lengths of trip chains, followed by the percentage of the total trip chains.

A validation module which takes in Household data and then counts and records the amount of trips created for each trip purpose. This is an important validation step as one needs to make sure that the distribution of trips between the different trip purposes is logical. 
Note: The Expanded trips parameter lets the user choose whether or not he/she wants to look at expansion factors or just frequencies.
This module is designed to export trip records where for persons within the selected household zones and then further restricted by employment zones.
This module outputs OD Matrices for trips by type of trip and by mode

This module is designed to capture the assignment of student's from household zone to school zone. This can then be used to validate PoRPoS models. Built for GTAModelV4.0+.
The matrix will be saved in the OD square csv format.
This module is designed to extract out the purposes of trips, in a given time period, by persons over a given age.  The result is a matrix in the EMME4+ binary format.

This module is designed to extract the assignments of place of residence - place of work by analyzing the population as they are being processed through the TASHA pipeline.  It will produce eight files, one for each occupation category, for full-time and part-time employment.

A Performance Measure that counts and records the amount of trips created for each trip purpose.
Note: The Expanded trips parameter lets the user choose whether or not he/she wants to look at expansion factors or just frequencies.
This module is designed to extract out vehicle kilometer's traveled (VKTs) by home zone for the given modes.
This module produces the information to compare against the following file format. FROM,TO,ABB,HBM,HBO,NHB
This module reads in the output of ZonalModeSplits and aggregates it to the planning district level.
This module reads in the output of ZonalModeSplits and aggregates it to the regional level.
This module is designed to extract out data on each person, trip, trip mode assignment, and station choice fromGTAModelV4.0.  Data is only recorded for the final iteration.
This module is designed to get the mode splits originating from a given area by personal attributes.
This module is designed to export a general SparseArray<float> resource to disk.
